problem_text:
Does there exist a group which is not isomorphic to outer automorphism group of a metabelian group with trivial center?
R. G¨obel
answer: No, given any group G there is a metabelian group M with trivial center such that Out M ∼= G (R. G¨obel, A. Paras, J. Pure Appl. Algebra, 149, no. 3 (2000) 251–266), and if G is finite or countable then M above can be chosen countable (R. G¨obel, A. Paras, in: Abelian Groups and Modules, Proc. Int. Conf. Dublin, 1998, Birkh¨auser, Basel, 1999, 309–317).
